revised_title: Discovery and Observation of Double Stars in 1779
tldr: Nathanael Pigott discovered three new double stars in 1779 and shared his observations with the Royal Society. He used a three-foot achromatic telescope to determine the right ascensions and declinations of these stars. Pigott also developed a method to observe faint stars by using the transit instrument's wires, which could potentially be useful for other astronomers. The article includes the coordinates of the discovered double stars.
